page.topic: Creating a Table and Exporting Selected Records to the Back-End
page.description: The following script selects records from the Alpha Sports customer.dbf table and writes them to a new table named "CustomerX" in the Access AlphaSport.mdb database.

section.description: Start by defining variables. In this case you need SQL::Connection, SQL::ResultSet, and SQL::TableInfo objects.
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim ti as SQL::TableInfo dim source_table as C dim destination_table as C dim tbl as P

section.description: Define the source and destination tables.
Read the properties of the source table. SQL_TableInfoOfDBF() sets the values of the ti SQL::TableInfo object to reflect the properties of source_table.
section.example: if .not. SQL_TableInfoOfDBF(source_table, ti) then ui_msg_box("Error", "Could not read properties of " + source_table) end end if

section.description: Connect to the back-end database. If there is an error, display a message and end the script.
section.example: if .not. conn.open("{A5API=Access,FileName='C:\Program Files\A5V8\MDBFiles\Alphasports.mdb',UserName='Admin'}") then ui_msg_box("Error", "Could not establish connection" + crlf()+ conn.CallResult.text) end end if

section.description: Create the new destination table in the back-end database with the CreateTable() method. If there is an error, display a message, close the connection, and end the script.
section.example: ti.Name = destination_table then if .not. conn.CreateTable(ti) ui_msg_box("Error", "Could not create back-end table" + crlf()+ conn.CallResult.text) conn.close() end end if

section.description: Select the records to copy. Read the data from the source table into the rs SQL::ResultSet object with the ResultSetFromDBF() method.
section.example: tbl = table.open(source_table) query.filter = "bill_state_region = \"MA\"" tbl.query_create() rs = conn.ResultSetFromDBF(tbl)

section.description: Add the selected records to the destination_table with the InsertData() method.
section.example: if .not. conn.InsertData("", destination_table, rs) ui_msg_box("Error", "Could not insert data into back-end table" + crlf()+ conn.CallResult.text) conn.close() end end if

section.description: Close the table and the connection.
